name: sven
description: Integrated Subversion source control with Positron IDE support. Privacy-focused: zero telemetry, local-only operations.

scripts.test: npm run test:unit && if [ "$CI" = "true" ]; then npm run test:e2e; fi

_comment_security: Known dev-only vulnerability: glob@10.4.5 in npm@10.9.4 (transitive via @semantic-release/npm@12.0.2). This is a dev dependency only, vulnerability is in glob CLI --cmd flag (we use library API). Production dependencies have 0 vulnerabilities. Risk: LOW. See docs/SECURITY_NOTES.md for details.

viewsWelcome.contents:
View the commit history of your repository.

[Show Log](command:svn.log)

Tip: Use the log to browse commits, view changes, and understand project history.

Select a file in the explorer to view its revision history.

Right-click any file and choose **SVN: Show Log** to see its history here.

Compare your branch against trunk to see what's changed.

This view shows commits unique to your branch that haven't been merged to trunk yet.

Choose which folders and files to download from the repository.

Expand folders to browse server contents. De-emphasized items are on the server but not downloaded locally.

[Refresh](command:svn.sparse.refresh)

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with SVN
walkthroughs.description: Set up SVN and learn the basics

steps.title: Verify SVN Installation
steps.description:
Ensure SVN command-line tools are installed on your system.

Open a terminal and run:
```
svn --version
```

If not installed, download from [Apache Subversion](https://subversion.apache.org/packages.html).

steps.title: Open a Repository
steps.description:
Open an existing working copy or checkout a new repository.

[Checkout Repository](command:svn.checkout)

Or simply open a folder that contains a `.svn` directory.

steps.title: Tour the SCM Panel
steps.description:
The Source Control panel has 5 views:

- **Incoming Changes**: Updates from the server
- **Repo History**: Commit log
- **File History**: Per-file revisions
- **Branch Changes**: Your branch vs trunk
- **Selective Download**: Sparse checkout

[Open Source Control](command:workbench.view.scm)

steps.title: Check for Updates
steps.description:
See what others have committed before you start working.

[Check for Incoming Changes](command:svn.refreshRemoteChanges)

Tip: Enable `svn.sourceControl.checkForIncomingChanges` for automatic checks.

steps.title: Update Working Copy
steps.description:
Pull the latest changes from the server.

[Update](command:svn.update)

This merges remote changes into your local files.

steps.title: Stage Your Changes
steps.description:
After editing files, stage them for commit.

[Stage All Changes](command:svn.stageAll)

Or click the **+** icon next to individual files in the Source Control view.

steps.title: Commit Changes
steps.description:
Save your staged changes to the repository.

[Commit](command:svn.commit)

Write a clear commit message describing what you changed and why.

walkthroughs.title: Investigate Code History
walkthroughs.description: Understand who changed what and when

steps.title: View File History
steps.description:
See all revisions of a file.

Right-click any file in Explorer and select **SVN: Show Log**.

[Show Repository Log](command:svn.log)

steps.title: Toggle Blame Annotations
steps.description:
See who last modified each line of code.

[Toggle Blame](command:svn.blame.toggleBlame)

Hover over annotations to see commit details.

steps.title: Compare Revisions
steps.description:
View differences between file versions.

In the File History view, click any revision to see its changes.

Or right-click and select **Open Diff**.

steps.title: Enable Sparse Mode
steps.description:
For large repositories, download only the folders you need.

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%22svn.sparse%22)

Enable `svn.sparse.enabled` to activate the Selective Download view.

steps.title: Select Folders
steps.description:
Use the **Selective Download** view to choose which folders to download.

- Expand folders to browse server contents
- Check/uncheck to include/exclude
- De-emphasized items are on server only

[Refresh Sparse View](command:svn.sparse.refresh)

steps.title: Lock a File
steps.description:
Prevent others from editing while you work.

[Lock File](command:svn.lock)

Right-click a file in Explorer or Source Control and select **SVN: Lock**.

Ideal for binary files (images, docs) that can't be merged.

steps.title: Commit & Unlock
steps.description:
Committing automatically releases locks.

Or manually unlock without committing:

[Unlock File](command:svn.unlock)

Note: Admins can break others' locks with **SVN: Break Lock**.

steps.title: Set Auto-Lock Property
steps.description:
Mark files that should always require locking.

[Toggle Needs-Lock](command:svn.toggleNeedsLock)

Sets `svn:needs-lock` property. File becomes read-only until locked.

commands.title: Open diff with BASE (Your Last Update)
Open Changes with BASE (Your Last Update)

editor/title.when: svnOpenRepositoryCount != 0 && isInDiffEditor && resourceScheme != extension && resourceScheme != merge-conflicts.conflicts-diff

sven.path.markdownDescription:
Path to the `svn` executable. Leave empty to use system PATH.

Example: `/usr/local/bin/svn` or `C:\Program Files\TortoiseSVN\bin\svn.exe`

sven.autorefresh.markdownDescription: Automatically refresh file status when files change on disk.

sven.commit.conventionalCommits.markdownDescription: Use [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/) format (`feat:`, `fix:`, `docs:`, etc). Guided commit flow helps you create consistent commit messages.

enumDescriptions: Update before commit only (prevents out-of-date errors)
Update after commit only (syncs BASE revision)
sven.commit.autoUpdate.markdownDescription:
When to run `svn update` around commits.

- **both**: Sync before (avoid conflicts) and after (update BASE)
- **before**: Only sync before commit
- **after**: Only sync after commit
- **none**: Manual updates only

sven.commit.useQuickPick.markdownDescription: Use native VS Code QuickPick for commit dialog. Set `false` for webview-based commit form.

sven.commit.checkEmptyMessage.description: Warn before committing with empty message

sven.commit.changes.selectedAll.description: Select all staged files by default when committing

sven.sourceControl.changesLeftClick.markdownDescription:
Action when clicking a file in Source Control view:
- `open`: Open the file
- `open diff`: Show diff with BASE revision

sven.sourceControl.countUnversioned.description: Include unversioned files in the badge count

sven.sourceControl.hideUnversioned.description: Hide unversioned files from Source Control view

sven.sourceControl.ignore.markdownDescription:
Glob patterns for files to hide from Source Control view (like `.gitignore`).

Example: `["**/*.js", "*.jar", "/log"]`

sven.sourceControl.ignoreOnCommit.description: Changelists to exclude from commit operations

sven.sourceControl.ignoreOnStatusCount.description: Changelists to exclude from badge count

sven.sourceControl.combineExternalIfSame.description: Show externals in main repository if from the same server

sven.blame.enabled.markdownDescription: **Master toggle** for SVN blame functionality. When disabled, all blame features are hidden.

sven.blame.autoBlame.markdownDescription: Automatically show blame annotations when opening files. Toggle with `SVN: Toggle Blame` command.

sven.blame.enableLogs.markdownDescription: Fetch commit messages for blame tooltips. **Disable for faster blame** on large repositories.

sven.blame.showWorkingCopyChanges.description: Highlight uncommitted changes in blame view

sven.blame.largeFileWarning.description: Show warning before blaming files exceeding line limit

sven.blame.largeFileLimit.description: Line count threshold for large file warning (0 to disable)

sven.blame.gutter.enabled.markdownDescription: Show colored revision indicators in the gutter (left of line numbers). Each color represents a different commit age.

sven.blame.gutter.showIcons.description: Show colored revision icons in gutter

sven.blame.inline.enabled.markdownDescription: Show inline blame annotations at end of lines (GitLens-style).

sven.blame.inline.currentLineOnly.description: Only show inline annotation on current line (cursor position)

sven.blame.inline.showMessage.markdownDescription: Include commit message in inline annotation. **Slower** - requires fetching log data.

sven.blame.inline.opacity.description: Opacity of inline annotations (0.0 = invisible, 1.0 = solid)

sven.blame.statusBar.enabled.description: Show blame info for current line in status bar

sven.sparse.confirmExclude.markdownDescription: Show confirmation before excluding folders (removes files from disk).

sven.sparse.largeFileWarningMb.markdownDescription: Warn before downloading files larger than this (MB). Set `0` to disable.

sven.sparse.downloadTimeoutMinutes.description: Timeout for download operations (minutes). Increase for large folders.

sven.remoteChanges.checkFrequency.markdownDescription: Interval (seconds) to check for remote changes. Shows count in status bar. Set `0` to disable.

sven.refresh.remoteChanges.description: Include remote changes check when running Refresh command

sven.update.ignoreExternals.markdownDescription: Skip externals when updating (`--ignore-externals`). Faster updates if externals not needed.

enumDescriptions: System keyring locally, extension storage remotely (recommended)
Use native credential stores (Windows Credential Manager, gnome-keyring, macOS Keychain)
Use VS Code SecretStorage (isolated, works in all environments)
sven.auth.credentialMode.markdownDescription: How SVN credentials are stored. See [credentials documentation](https://github.com/vrognas/sven#credentials) for details.

sven.auth.commandTimeout.markdownDescription: Timeout (seconds) for SVN commands. Increase for slow VPN/remote connections.

sven.log.length.markdownDescription: Number of commits to show in history views. Higher values use more memory.

sven.log.authorColors.description: Show colored dots for different authors in history view

sven.diff.withHead.markdownDescription: Compare with HEAD (server latest) instead of BASE (your last update).

sven.diff.tool.markdownDescription:
Path to external diff tool. Example: `C:\Program Files\Beyond Compare 5\BCompare.exe`

Uses `svn diff --diff-cmd`.

sven.layout.trunkRegex.markdownDescription:
Regex to detect trunk path. Set `null` to disable.

Default matches: `trunk/...`

sven.layout.trunkRegexName.description: Regex capture group for trunk name

sven.layout.branchesRegex.markdownDescription:
Regex to detect branches path. Set `null` to disable.

Default matches: `branches/<name>/...`

sven.layout.branchesRegexName.description: Regex capture group for branch name

sven.layout.tagsRegex.markdownDescription:
Regex to detect tags path. Set `null` to disable.

Default matches: `tags/<name>/...`

sven.layout.tagRegexName.description: Regex capture group for tag name

sven.layout.showFullName.markdownDescription:
Show full path in branch names:
- `true`: `branches/feature-x`
- `false`: `feature-x`

sven.multipleFolders.enabled.markdownDescription: Scan for SVN repositories in subfolders. Enable for monorepos with multiple SVN roots.

sven.multipleFolders.depth.description: Maximum folder depth to scan for SVN repositories

sven.multipleFolders.ignore.description: Folders to skip when scanning for SVN repositories

sven.performance.maxXmlTags.markdownDescription:
Maximum XML tags to parse. Default works for repos <50k files.

- **100k+ files**: Set to `2000000`
- **Monorepos**: Set to `5000000`
- **Unlimited**: Set to `0` (not recommended)

sven.conflicts.autoResolve.markdownDescription: Automatically mark file as resolved after fixing conflict markers. **Use with caution** - only enable if you always resolve conflicts fully.

enumDescriptions: Do nothing when files are deleted
sven.delete.actionForDeletedFiles.description: Action when tracked files are deleted in Explorer

sven.delete.ignoredRulesForDeletedFiles.markdownDescription: Glob patterns for files to ignore when deleted. Example: `["*.log", "temp/**"]`

sven.decorator.baseColor.markdownDescription: Color for the BASE revision badge (B) in repository log. Uses VS Code theme colors.

sven.decorator.serverColor.markdownDescription: Color for the Server revision badge (S) in repository log. Shows commits not yet synced to your working copy.

sven.default.encoding.markdownDescription:
Force specific encoding for SVN output. Leave `null` for auto-detection.

Example: `windows-1252` for legacy Windows repos.

sven.detectIgnored.description: Scan ignored folders for SVN repositories

sven.previousCommitsUser.markdownDescription: Filter commit history to specific user. Requires SVN 1.8+.

sven.ignoreRepositories.markdownDescription: List of repository paths to ignore. Use for excluding specific working copies.

sven.ignoreMissingSvnWarning.description: Suppress warning when SVN executable not found

sven.ignoreWorkingCopyIsTooOld.description: Suppress warning when working copy needs upgrade

sven.showOutput.description: Show SVN output panel on extension start

enumDescriptions: Log auth mode once at startup
Log auth mode with every command (verbose)
sven.output.authLogging.description: Auth mode logging frequency in output panel

sven.debug.disableSanitization.markdownDescription:
** SECURITY WARNING**: Disable error sanitization for debugging. Raw paths and credentials will be visible in logs.

**Enable only temporarily for troubleshooting.**
